subject: Law
title: Popular Sovereignty
description: A quick win: understand Popular Sovereignty.

hook.text: Kings once claimed divine right to rule. The Constitution's first three words rejected that idea forever.

buildup.text: 'We the People' declares that government power comes from the governed, not from God or tradition.

discovery.text: Popular sovereignty means citizens are the ultimate source of authority in a constitutional system.

twist.text: In 1787, 'the People' excluded women, enslaved persons, and most non-landowners. The idea evolved slowly.

climax.text: Amendments gradually expanded who counted as 'the People'‚Äîeach one a hard-won battle.

punchline.text: The promise was written in 1787. Keeping it took centuries.

quiz.question: What does popular sovereignty mean?
options: Government authority comes from the people
